# 𓃀 𓈖 𓅡 𓅷 𓅣 PHOENIX

Wanderwort, strongly related to the far-spread Venus religion and later (non-exhaustive!) Phoenician ethnie.
A word similar to Phoenician is needed used in a similar way as Bhuddhist, Christian and Muslim:

Pinikian / Piniker := Follower of the Phoenike (Pinikism?) religion:

𓃀 𓈖 𓇋 𓇜 𓈒 𓏥 | dates | ⲃⲉⲗϩⲱⲗ belhōl بلحة balaḥa ⇔ ball
𓃀 𓈖 𓇋 𓇜 𓈒 𓏥 | dates | φοῖνιξ phoînix 𐀡𐀛𐀐 po-ni-ke 𐀡𐀛𐀑𐀠 po-ni-ki-pi (𐀠:fruit?) 𓃀 𓈖 𓇋 𓏲 𓇜 𓏌 𓏥 | date-wine | palmula@Latin

φοῖνῐξ • (phoînix) m (genitive φοίνῑκος); third declension
1. purple or crimson
2. palm tree
3. date (the fruit of the date palm)
4. phoenix, the mythical bird derived from Egyptian mythology
5. (music) A guitar-like instrument invented by the Phoenicians

ფინიკის პალმა piniḳis ṗalma фи́никова fínikova φοῖνῐξ bu.nix 𐀛 ni 𐘝 NI νικύλεον نَخْلَة naḵla 𒄑𒊷

𒉾 peš₂ figs φοῖνῐξ phønike 𐘝 NI 𐀛 ni 𒃻 nig̃₂ in 𒃻𒉾 𒃻𒄃 Nager

Interestingly almost all forms are already present in Linear-B
𐀡-𐀛-𐀑-𐀊 po-ni-ki-ja phoenix
𐀡-𐀛-𐀑-𐀊 po-ni-ki-ja purple ⇔ 𐀡-𐀢-𐀩-𐀊 po-pu-re-ja
𐀡-𐀛-𐀑-𐀍 po-ni-ki-jo palm tree ⇔ 𐀛 νικύλεον "fig"

Most interestingly almost all forms are already present in Egyptian, including 5.) :
𓃀 𓈖 𓏏 𓆱 | harp | φοῖνῐξ : phoînix, a guitar-like instrument

«The relationship in the sense of 'mythical bird' and Egyptian bnw “phoenix, Bennu bird” is clear.»

Phoenix ⇔ Murex 𒈲 MUŠ
In Sanskrit, a snail-shell is called भूनाग bhūnāga which literally means bhū (earth) + nāga (serpent). ⲛϭⲏϫⲓ purple

According to Herodotus early Phoenician settlers “came via the red sea”, which makes the Punt connection credible.

𓎛 𓃀 𓅡 𓄿 𓃀 𓅡 𓄿 𓂻 waddle ←? ⇔ Heron

⇔ פֻוָ֕ה (p̄u·wāh, “a clan's name” & Arabic فُوَّه (fuwwah, “madder”, a plant whose root yields purple-red dye.

→ Latin: phoenīx
→ Old Armenian: փիւնիկ (pʿiwnik), փիւնիկս (pʿiwniks), փիւնիկոս (pʿiwnikos), փիւնիքս (pʿiwnikʿs), փոնիքս (pʿonikʿs)
→ Armenian: փյունիկ (pʿyunik)
→ Old Georgian: ფუვინკაჲ (puvinḳay)
→ Old Georgian: ფჳნიქსი (pwiniksi)
